Managing a team is not easy, and Iâ€™ve slowly started to realise it with time.

Itâ€™s not just about getting work done. Itâ€™s about:

- Making sure people are happy
- Making sure everyone feels heard
- Helping people grow in their careers
- Making sure the team works well together

Some days it feels like a big responsibility, but thatâ€™s what it is, taking care of people, not just tasks.

Still learning every day, but one thing is clear: when the team feels good, the work automatically gets better. ğŸ™Œ

We are building:

A consumer threatened to drag takeUforward to the consumer court.

Why? A user prepared on our platform for 2 months, got what he needed, and once doneâ€¦ went searching for any reason to get a refund, since he couldnâ€™t find any significant flaw in the platformâ€™s effectiveness.

Our product page clearly states:

- C++, Java, Python, JS, C#, and Go.
- No mention of any other language. No promise that weâ€™d ever add them.

Yet the refund demand was because we didnâ€™t have his preferred language.

Itâ€™s like eating at a restaurant, finishing your meal, and then asking for your money back because they didnâ€™t serve sushi, even though itâ€™s not on the menu.

Loved the â€œconsumer courtâ€ threat for something never listed nor promised.

Whatâ€™s next? Regional language coding support?

Tough to run a consumer-facing product ğŸ˜„

A faster, stronger takeUforward is coming.

We're taking a big call to make TUF faster, simpler, and more reliable for you all.

What's changing:
- Frontend: React â†’ Next.js
- Backend: Node.js â†’ Go
- Major UX upgrade (nothing around functionality)

Why Next.js?
- SSR/SSG â†’ Faster page loads & better SEO
- Code-splitting â†’ Smaller bundles, faster rendering
- Edge functions â†’ Lower latency for global users

Why Go?
- Compiled & statically typed â†’ Predictable performance
- Goroutines â†’ Handle thousands of concurrent requests efficiently
- Single binary â†’ Simpler deployment & scaling

Upgraded UX?
Yes, because we want to take things a notch higher and give every user that â€œwoahâ€ feeling with every click on our site. Also this is a part of the plan where we go global!

Also, we are making sure we go slow and follow all the good coding practices we had skipped while building the MVP due to time constraints, as we want to scale and build a few more products in the future, something that may not be possible with the current codebase if we donâ€™t refactor now.
